Product: Otium Wireless Headphones, Bluetooth Headphones, Otium Best Sports...
Reviews:
Very good Bluetooth headphones with one exception that almost made me return them. The bass, arghhh the base is way out of proportion. Please stop with the over emphasis on this one component of music, what is it with everyone jumping on the over use of bass in their music. Bass is one of many components that make music beautiful and it plays an important part yes but it is not the holy grail. At first I could barely make out the vocals and other instruments due to the extreme bass incorporated into this product. I was about to return them hoping to find a more balanced set of headphones. BUT then I remembered oh ya they make equalizers just for this very purpose. To fine tune the listening experience to your satisfaction. Since these will only ever be used (in my case) with a smartphone or iPAD this was a simple fix. Now my music is almost just how I want it. I’ll be tweaking the sound for a little longer until I get it just right. Don’t be afraid of equalizers if you have never used one. Don’t panic take a screenshot of the initial settings for reference and then just dive in and play with all the sliders, you will know when you have come close to your preferred setting, problem solved.

OK NOW THE GOOD! These feel really good on my earlobes and in my ears, just really comfortable. Even without music on these block what I think is a good amount of distracting noise. There are many Bluetooth headphones that are very similar to these but these had a slight style advantage over most that I came across. The price was reasonable and the construction feels very solid. The buttons are all in the right place and easy to identify. I like the silicone cord tightening piece, I don’t like things dangling near around my head very distracting and I inevitably get the cord caught on something and yank my headphones right out of my ears...aggravating. These are also very loud when set to the upper settings, I don’t advise it, seriously a bad idea and the music gets very distorted at the uppermost range. But I have to admit I do like the freedom to destroy my ears if I want too. Too much product nannying going on these days, I cry FREEDOM! Ok that’s a bit extreme but the point is made.

For the price I think these are hard to beat, I did a lot of researching because I am insane enough to drive myself loony comparing devices, options available, reviews and style within a price range that doesn’t send me into and obsessive compulsive spiral to keep them perfect.... believe me you don’t ever wanna know what that’s like.

To sum it up these are a very good choice in my opinion, only time will tell. You should certainly pay the $20 admission fee to try them out. Download a high rated free equalizer app that doesn’t demand permissions the app has absolutely no reasonable explanation for needing. Happy Listening 👂!

Product: Otium Wireless Headphones, Bluetooth Headphones, Otium Best Sports...
Reviews:
These headphones are not "noise cancelling" as listed in the description; they are sound-isolating in that they behave like ear plugs with speakers, rather than actively removing background noise as the description implies. If you are looking to buy these as a "noise cancelling headset" (like a Bose headset) you will want to look elsewhere.

That said, as a basic bluetooth headset, these aren't bad. The ear clips are a little flimsy and don't provide a positive feel for being held in, rather they are just to keep the earpiece from falling to the ground when (not if) the friction fit of the earbud gives way. A stiffer material would go a long way in this area.
Sound quality is good, bass is more pronounced than typical of a small speaker like this. Mids and highs are a little muted/muddy, but can typically be compensated for with the music app of your choice (or a sound equalizer app).

All in all - I wouldn't purchase these again at full price, but as a lightning deal they are a decent set of bluetooth earbuds. There are much better available in the price range.

These heads phones work well in the respect that they connect to your phone easily and they sound.....pretty good for the money. However I'm an audiophile, I actually mix tracks for a living so I don't know how I ever thought that these headphones which were on sale for like 16 bucks on sale...normally like 27 were going to live up to my demands. I guess I just couldn't pass up a smokin deal. That and I trusted the majority of the reviews which said great things about these.

At the end of the day I was seriously concerned about using wireless headphones at all considering how much quality gets lost in the air when you lose the cord with headphones, let alone when dealing with cheaper ones. Now...let me just say ...I am knocking these headphones...but considering they were as cheap as they were, I almost feel guilty about it because back in the day when I was a kid....this kind of quality would have been impossible for this price...if at all. So it's cool to think about how far we've come.

But as my video review says..overall they're 7 out of 10. The sound is actually surprisingly good...and they do get loud...so you can push them a bit. But the sound does start to come apart. There's not much low end bass...so whoever made them tries to make up for that with some high bass that sounds kinda cardboardish sounding. Hallow you could say...right about 300 HZ which I tried to EQ out with my phone to get them to sound better. It kinda worked but not altogether and they still left me wanting more. Much more.

Do they work well enough for an hour at the gym for 16 bucks..yes. Am I surprised at the sound....yes....amazed..NO! But am I amazed at how much you can get for 16 bucks all in?...yes. But here is the real question that matters. Will I ALWAYS be thinking to myself about how much I wish I had a better pair while I'm wearing them. HELL YES.

With that being said,...I think this is one of those situations where you actually get more than you pay for...but even saying that...they still aren't up to the standards of what I would expect with a rockin pair of bluetooth headphones. So I wouldn't buy again...unless I just wanted a throw away pair of blue tooth headphones.

Regards!

They fit nice around the ear, I do weight lifting and some cardio (bike or elliptical) so they don't move to much, I don't know if they would be as confortable for a runner, I'm guessing maybe not (be sure to try all tip sizes). Then If I like them so much why not give them 5 stars?... Well here is the thing, the sound. They could sound so much better than they do just by setting them to a "flatter" response curve, I'll explain my self: It looks like they wanted these to sound heavy on the low end and adjusted them to give more volumen there sacrificing quality (they sound a little distorted). I know they are not audiophile or high quality audio headphones, but if they change the response curve lowering the low end volume they could sound so much better. The high end is there, a little rolled down but that's expected for the price range. The good news is you can use your phone's adjustments or equalizer to tame the low end to your liking which eliminates the distortion. Over all I enjoy my new headphones, the package was cardboard which I like, and they came with 3 different size earplugs. They came with a case, nice addition, but I find it a little too big, I wish it was smaller and the soft kind, nevertheless it is still very convenient.
